task.name: Credibility Validation Framework
task.objective: Run two-layer validation on institutional architecture blueprints (internal agent review + user confirmation)

llm.mandate: Execute both validation layers systematically - credibility quality AND contextual accuracy
Flag issues clearly and provide specific recommendations
Validate against Stanford Credibility Guidelines and Trust Signal Framework

inputs.input: The complete architecture with all sections
Stakeholder insights from The Audience Oracle

layer-1.title: Internal Agent Validation - Credibility Quality
layer-1.description: Simulate each specialist agent reviewing the blueprint against their expertise area

agent.name: The Audience Oracle
agent.check: Does architecture serve all primary stakeholders?
Are stakeholder conflicts appropriately resolved?
Will each key audience find what they need?
Are stakeholder pathways clear and accessible?
Is information depth appropriate for each audience?
Are secondary stakeholders adequately served?

validation-criteria.pass: All primary stakeholders have clear pathways
Stakeholder conflicts resolved with appropriate trade-offs

agent.name: Trust Guardian
agent.check: Are Stanford Web Credibility Guidelines addressed?
Is trust signal density appropriate for trust level?
Is credibility built progressively through the page?
Are all 6 trust signal categories considered?
Is proof appropriate for claims made?
Are potential trust-breakers avoided?

validation-criteria.pass: Stanford guidelines appropriately addressed for trust level
validation-criteria.flag: Insufficient trust signals for trust level

agent.name: Sector Cipher
agent.check: Does architecture match sector credibility expectations?
Are sector best practices incorporated?
Is credibility differentiation clear?
Are identified gaps leveraged for advantage?

validation-criteria.flag: Missing opportunities to stand out on credibility
Too similar to sector generic approach

agent.name: Narrative Architect
agent.check: Does narrative flow create cohesive trust journey?
Does each section build on previous sections?
Is progressive revelation respected?
Is the trust arc clear and intentional?
Are transitions between sections smooth?

validation-criteria.pass: Clear trust journey from start to finish
validation-criteria.flag: Trust momentum loss at any point

agent.name: Content Compass
agent.check: Does content hierarchy serve both users and SEO?
Is page connected to broader content ecosystem?
Are internal linking opportunities identified?
Is content depth appropriate for page type?

synthesis.action: Identify critical issues requiring immediate fix
If critical issues exist, refine blueprint before Layer 2
If all clear, proceed to user validation

layer-2.title: User Confirmation Checkpoints - Contextual Accuracy
layer-2.description: Present architecture to user with strategic validation questions

checkpoint.question:
Present the overall strategic approach and lead section:
"This architecture leads with [APPROACH] because [STRATEGIC REASON based on matrix/stakeholders/research].
Does this feel right for how you want your organization perceived?"

listen-for.signal: Strong disagreement or "that won't work because..."

checkpoint.action: If yellow or red signal, probe deeper: - "What feels off about this approach?" - "What do you know about your organization that we might be missing?" - "How would you prefer to lead?"

checkpoint.question:
Validate stakeholder prioritization:
"We've prioritized [PRIMARY STAKEHOLDER] for this page because [RATIONALE from The Audience Oracle].
Does this match your audience priority for this page?"

listen-for.signal: "Yes, that's exactly who this page is for"
"Sort of, but we also need to serve..."

checkpoint.action: If misalignment detected: - Capture the real stakeholder priority - Adjust architecture to reflect true audience focus - Re-validate with The Audience Oracle logic

checkpoint.question:
Confirm trust signal strategy:
"The trust-building strategy emphasizes [SIGNALS] because [SECTOR RESEARCH and MATRIX POSITION].
Does this align with your credibility assets and positioning goals?"

listen-for.signal: "Maybe, but I'm not sure we have..."

checkpoint.action: If concerns raised: - Understand their actual credibility assets better - Adjust trust signal approach accordingly - Ensure we're building on real strengths, not assumed ones

iteration.rule: If user identifies misalignments in any checkpoint:
iteration.action: Discuss the concern to understand context
Capture insights they have that agents didn't
Refine blueprint to incorporate new understanding

outputs.output: Complete validation report from both layers
Any critical or high-priority issues found
Pass | Pass with recommendations | Needs revision

validation.check: Any issues either resolved or documented
